properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong wind gusts up to 100 km/h today in southwestern Alberta. Wind gusts, at times reaching 100 km/h, developed overnight and will continue through the morning. These strong winds will weaken by late this afternoon. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T03:06:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T11:07:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2679565301.2021

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of pollutants are expected through Friday morning and will result in poor air quality, especially in metropolitan areas where pollutant emissions are more significant. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. In Quebec, wood heating is the main source of fine particles that contribute to smog during winter. This activity generates the largest number of these particulates, more than industrial activities and transportation. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-02-19T21:59:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2021-02-19T01:24:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2702911722.2021
Area: La Sarre area, Amos area, Lebel-sur-Quévillon area, Senneterre area, Rouyn area, Malartic area, Val d'Or - Louvicourt area

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls may impact the area into Friday afternoon. Travel along Highway 17 between White River and Wawa may become hazardous due to heavy snow and poor visibility. Accumulations in excess of 15 cm are possible, although the shifting nature of the snow bands may limit accumulations. At this point, it appears that the heaviest amounts will occur south of Highway 17. The snow squalls should move east of the region by late Friday. ### Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-19T19:59:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T08:58:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3831116755.2021
Area: White River - Dubreuilville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. A pacific frontal system is generating snow over the Kitimat area. The snow will change to rain showers this morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-19T22:59:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T10:00:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0891550301.2021
Area: North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls continue today. Snow squalls have developed between Wawa and White River south of Highway 17 and will move into the town of Wawa later this morning. The snow squalls will drift into the Agawa region this afternoon. Travel along Highway 17 between Wawa and Agawa Bay may become hazardous due to heavy snow and poor visibility. Accumulations up to 10 cm are possible. The snow squalls are expected to move south of the region this evening. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T02:59:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T11:00:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3190050975.2021
Area: Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 5 to 10 cm is expected. A frontal system is bringing snow mixed with rain to the Fraser Valley - east including Hope region tonight. Local snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are expected by this morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-19T20:24:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T08:44:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1786764071.2021
Area: Fraser Valley - east including Hope
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Accumulating snow is expected tonight and Saturday. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm. Locations: most of Nova Scotia, including Halifax Metro. Time span: this evening until late Saturday. Remarks: Snow will begin spreading across western Nova Scotia early this evening and will spread eastward across the province tonight, reaching Cape Breton by early Saturday morning. The snow will taper to flurries during the day Saturday over western areas and Saturday evening over eastern areas. The highest amounts of snow will likely be along the Atlantic coast and also in onshore northeasterly winds over Pictou and Antigonish counties. There is still considerable uncertainty regarding snowfall amounts and snowfall warnings may be issued later today. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T00:02:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T08:03:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3006862307.2021
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Digby County, Lunenburg County, Queens County, Shelburne County, Yarmouth County, Hants County, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning. What: Snow. Where: Portions of the Greater Toronto Area. When: Now through 9 a.m. Discussion: Snow continues this morning. Continued snowfall combined with recent snowfall will likely make for a slow morning commute this morning. Actions: Drivers should plan to give themselves extra time to reach their destination. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop. See snow go slow! ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-19T15:59:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T09:17:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0940623278.2021
Area: City of Toronto, Mississauga - Brampton, Halton Hills - Milton, Burlington - Oakville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of very cold wind chills is expected. Wind chills intermittently reaching -50 continue to affect Arctic Bay, Pond Inlet and Clyde River. Conditions will moderate slightly today but return tonight before ending throughout the region on Saturday. ### Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T01:17:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T09:18:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3949490818.2021
Area: Arctic Bay, Pond Inlet, Clyde River
properties.Author: Environment Canada
